item.title: Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analytics Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity? 

As an Analytics Developer, you will develop our analytics infrastructure to make it more flexible, reliable, and performant. This role requires cooperation, coordination with quant, trading, and IT groups. You possess strong programming and API design skills.

Previous projects with low latency or high throughput analytics, and interest in financial products across asset classes would be preferred, but isn’t necessary.

What will you do? 

  • Refactor and consolidate analytics-related functionality.
  • Design robust API’s around common pieces of functionality, refactoring the code to support these new APIs, retire legacy code, and ensure that structural problems are also addressed during the refactoring.
  • Investigate and fix stability problems, determine what the fundamental solution should be, and prioritize accordingly.
  • Identify and address gaps in test coverage.
  • Interface with vendor systems, expose analytics to Excel and Risk systems.
  • Proposes the design and implementation of strategic analytics API’s.
  • Analyze and fix performance and stability problems in the internal analytics layers.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must Have:

  • Strong command of C++, Python or Java.
  • Expert in algorithms and data structures, object orientation, design patterns, and functional programming paradigms.
  • Excellent problem solving and quantitative skills.
  • Excellent API design, refactoring, profiling and code optimization skills.
  • Experience as a senior developer or team lead.

Nice to have:

  • Expertise with designing and supporting financial analytics API’s.
  • Experience with databases, distributed cache products, distributed and multithreaded computation, big data processing technologies such as Spark.
  • Experience with multiple platforms (Windows, Linux), compilers and tools for C++ development.
  • Experience with .Net.
  • Experience with build/test/release infrastructure.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

RBC exige, à titre de condition d’emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d’entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Capital Markets

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-05-02-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-10-28-07:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

item.title: Analyst, Profitability and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analyst, Profitability and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will establish, track and report business metrics across profitability, opportunity, risk and supervisory. You will create client and market insights driven by profitability metrics to inform future path using a data and commercially led approach to establish profitability benchmarks and hurdle rates by product, service bundles and clients as the team shifts additional focus and resources to analytics to support Executive Management directives.

What will you do?

  • Manage the review process of financial models with a focus on profitability (e.g. Client Profitability Model) collaborating with Finance and the Business to ensure accuracy
  • Develop a thorough understanding of profitability models (Client and Product profitability), identify enhancements needed and support partners in implementation
  • Point person for profitability evaluation, execution, and analysis on products and clients as well as other analysis across multiple client segments and categories
  • Support the preparation of regular summary reports for senior audience, identifying risks and issues for attention, and developing recommendations
  • Assist with creating metrics and manage and analyze key operational KPIs and trends
  • Provide analysis of profitability impact on actions implemented across products and clients
  • Support the Pricing team on repricing/new pricing requests
  • Responsible for enforcing best-in-class profitability processes including data consistency and presentment.
  • Partner with Product, Business Development, and Client Success groups to collaboratively improve upon profit strategies & market plans
  • Elevate and increase the visibility of profitability and ensure key participants in the Client Success, Product and Business Development have profitability considerations top of mind

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • University or post-graduate degree in Business, Economics or Finance.
  • High level of numeracy and experience in financial analysis 
  • Demonstrated ability to understand key drivers of financial performance and magnitude of impact
  • Proficient in the MS Office suite of products with expertise in Excel
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, with particular emphasis on the ability to translate between technical and business terminology, and to formulate clear actionable insights
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to foster good working relationships within and across business units at all levels of seniority
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills

Nice-to-have:

  • CFA, MBA or other professional accounting/finance designation
  • Prior experience in the securities industry and/or in RBC I&TS in related functions
  • Exposure to RBC I&TS core products/systems


 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference for our clients and in our communities, and achieving mutual success. This position will provide you with the foundation required for a prosperous career in the banking industry.

  • Excellent exposure to communicate with various business partners and stakeholders in Investor & Treasury Services and within other platforms as appropriate.
  • Opportunity to obtain hands-on experience throughout your role.
  • Working with an exciting, close-knit, supportive & dynamic group.
  • Opportunity to collaborate with other business segments within the bank.
  • Excellent career development and progression opportunities.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits.
  • Competitive compensation.

item.title: Developer - RAMPP Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Developer - RAMPP Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Credit Trading desks at RBC are undergoing significant investment to modernize the calculation and speed of their existing trading platform.  Throughout 2022 and onwards we aim to move the business to a modern distributed pricing based framework, utilizing python, Kubernetes and docker for distribution.  You will work to build out a greenfield credit trading platform, building microservices for pricing, and working directly and closely with front office trading and quant teams.  The role will involve a lot of direct communication with front office users and will be based in RBC’s new London office at 100 Bishopsgate.

What will you do?

  • Work with our Front office and quant trading teams to understand their existing risk and pricing systems
  • Implement pricing and booking services in python
  • Develop high quality service-oriented REST endpoints
  • Work closely with a Front-End team to deliver a consolidated platform
  • Ensure the platform can perform effectively by utilising Kubernetes-based scaling technologies

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Excellent python experience
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Knowledge of building enterprise-class applications at scale
  • Basic financial knowledge in any asset class
  • Good knowledge of enterprise-level concepts such as integration and regression testing

Nice-to-have

  • Experience building containerised applications
  • Derivatives knowledge

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible working options fully supported.

Job Summary

Developer, XVA technology

Address:

London, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

City:

GBR-GREATER_LONDON-LONDON

Country:

United Kingdom

35

Employment Type:

Platform:

Capital Markets

Regular

item.title: Associate, Profitability and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate, Profitability and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Associate, Profitability and Analytics will establish, track and report business metrics across profitability, opportunity, risk and supervisory. In this role, will create client and market insights driven by profitability metrics to inform future path using a data and commercially led approach to establish profitability benchmarks and hurdle rates by product, service bundles and clients as the team shifts additional focus and resources to analytics to support Executive Management directives.

What will you do?

  • Responsible for profitability evaluation, execution, and analysis on products and clients as well as other analysis across multiple client segments and categories
  • Consume and integrate multiple data points into simple and clear data driven insights
  • Lead data and market driven analytics to support profit decisions, develops recommendations for profit improvement, and provides support for the execution
  • Partner across the organization to proactively identify areas of profit opportunity for new & existing products
  • Develop a thorough understanding of profitability models, identify enhancements needed and support partners in implementation
  • Provide analysis of profitability impact on actions implemented across products and clients
  • Support the Pricing team on repricing/new pricing requests
  • Collaborate with product leads and Pricing team in developing and refining standard rate schedules
  • Responsible for enforcing best-in-class profitability processes including data consistency and presentment.
  • Partner with Product, Business Development, and Client Success groups to collaboratively design profit strategies & market plans to then track and translate into financial results
  • Proactive identification of new revenue and profit expansion opportunities by the use of analytics and develop and lead look back analysis on recent client deals with input from various Stakeholder (Client Success, Product, Pricing, Business Development)
  • Elevate and increase the visibility of profitability and ensure key participants in the Client Success, Product and Business Development have profitability considerations top of mind.
  • Continually emphasis to key stakeholders about the importance of using business case financials as a tool to aid in the decision making process for new and existing business. Provide innovation of commercial models that can be applied according to different situations
  • Owner of the group’s policies and procedures library. Group representative on RBC’s PPL Governance Committee to ensure group adheres to RBC’s current policy and procedures rules and adapts any changes in the near future

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • University or post-graduate degree in Business, Economics or Finance.
  • High level of numeracy and experience in financial analysis  (Proven quality control skills to ensure Data Accuracy and strong business modeling and financial analytics skills)
  • Demonstrated ability to understand key drivers of financial performance and magnitude of impact
  • Proven self-starter with ability to identify and act on opportunities to drive change leading to  better financial outcomes
  • Strong organizational skills, independent prioritization
  • Ability to anticipate partner needs and make decisions in the face of ambiguity
  • Proficient in the MS Office suite of products with expertise in Excel
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, with particular emphasis on the ability to translate between technical and business terminology, and to formulate clear actionable insights
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to foster good working relationships within and across business units at all levels of seniority
  • Exceptional sense of urgency, and attention to detail and accuracy
  • Comfortable liaising with senior management and executives
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills

Nice-to-have

  • Prior experience in the securities industry and/or in RBC I&TS in related functions
  • Exposure to RBC I&TS core products/systems
  • CFA, MBA or other professional accounting/finance designation

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Excellent exposure to communicate with various business partners and stakeholders in Investor & Treasury Services and within other platforms as appropriate
  • Opportunity to obtain hands-on experience throughout your role
  • Working with an exciting, close-knit, supportive & dynamic group
  • Opportunity to collaborate with other business segments within the bank
  • Excellent career development and progression opportunities
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Competitive compensation

item.title: Manager, Cards Analytics and Insights
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Cards Analytics and Insights

Job Description

RBC is currently recruiting for a Manager role for the Cards, Payments and Banking team. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Providing end-to-end analytics advisory services including conceptualizing business questions, designing and executing analytics framework and recommending and influencing the credit card business for decision making purpose
  • Identifying underlying business trends using analytical tools and transforming them into actionable insights

What will you do?

  • Act as a subject matter expert regarding analytics / data science topics (e.g. data visualization, storytelling, KPI definition, statistical analysis, predictive modelling etc.).
  • Support business growth targets by understanding business needs and providing concise, insightful and timely analytics of key trends through interpretation of interplays between portfolio / business performance, costs and business strategy.
  • Assist Senior Manager and collaborate with business partners in rapid identification, prioritization and deployment of analytics to define new potential business opportunities and to support decisions through the provision of industry and competitor data.
  • Participate in cross-functional teams through the analytics process to make sound information-based decisions and develop robust measures to effectively identify, mitigate and monitor risks and opportunities.
  • Present and defend analysis and recommendations to a wide range of stakeholders and senior key decision makers.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have     

  • At least two previous work term experiences in clients, product, marketing or risk analytical or reporting role; Experiences in supporting credit card business and/or financial services industry an asset
  • Programming experience to extract data and complete complex analytics. SAS / SQL required. R, Python, etc. preferred
  • Instinctive curiosity and strategic mindset to drill into the analytics to understand business drivers and predict business growth and the technical ability to apply this knowledge to resolve complex business questions
  • Proven ability to communicate clearly and concisely to all levels of the company. Strong skills in presentation and story telling
  • A hunger for continued development and learning

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge in Hadoop, Google Analytics and Big Data environment
  • Advance degree in quantitative discipline

Job Summary

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Canada

item.title: Marketing Analytics Manager, RBCx Ventures
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Marketing Analytics Manager, RBCx Ventures

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Manager of Marketing Analytics, you will be joining the Performance Marketing Centre of Excellence within RBCx to lead the creation and implementation of an ideal analytics framework, supporting several ventures in a startup culture, rich with fast-thinking and a quick-to-market mindset; and also working closely with our teams in Royal Bank of Canada, one of Canada’s largest banks.

The ideal candidate should have the interest and ability to take on highly advanced measurement implementations in a hands on fashion. You will work across our portfolio of mobile applications, mobile web applications, desktop web properties, and work within social platforms (e.g., Facebook) to ensure data is accurately captured and actioned appropriately within our marketing analytics platforms (Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Appsflyer). With RBCx Ventures being a newer division of RBC, you have the opportunity to create and build upon a foundation that will shape the future growth of our businesses, and RBC.

What will you do?

  • Establish and implement proper marketing analytics standards and measurement plans analytical standards across multiple ventures/businesses to ensure all teams are set up for success when it comes to data collection and venture analysis.
  • Setup, maintain, and implement all tagging requirements across both mobile app/web and desktop web properties using Google Tag Manager and/or Javascript code
  • Provide technical support to internal and partner teams surrounding analytics tagging, data validation and data integration
  • Identify and implement all tagging requirements across both mobile app/web and desktop web properties
  • Assess and implement growth optimization tools such as Google Optimize, Unbounce and other A/B testing tools to improve & optimize on-site content
  • Guide and support key stakeholders in the appropriate implementation and validation of new tagging requirements and fixes, as well as ensuring existing tracking remains intact.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Readily sharable experience implementing analytical systems regardless of platform.
  • 3-5 years of digital analytics implementation or relevant experience
  • Experience with Tag Management tools such as Google Tag Manager, Segment, Tealium, others
  • Experience implementing web and advertising analytics tools such as Google Analytics 360, Appsflyer, Facebook Analytics, Google Optimize, Google Ads and others
  • Hands on experience coding in JavaScript events and jQuery as well as best practices for JavaScript coding
  • Paid advertising integrations i.e. App Conversion Events Integrations

Nice-to-have

  • Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or an International equivalent

  • Familiarity with front end SPA frameworks such as Angular and React preferred Web application programming experience (PHP, Java, Ruby, etc.) preferred Debugging techniques and tools for front end web development

  • Project Tracking software experience (Asana, Jira)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. 

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

RBCx

VSMARKETING

Job Summary

Supports the development and maintenance of scalable data stores that supply big data in forms needed for business analysis. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.

item.title: Developer - TM1 / Planning Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Developer - TM1 / Planning Analytics

Job Description

  • Drive Implementation and lead development and technical efforts for EPM using IBM Suite of products.
  • Design innovative solution using best practices and customizing for the business specific needs.
  • Make the granular design decisions around acquiring, loading data, coding principles.
  • Be a hands-on SME advising, implementing, testing and training.
  • Communicate timely and accurate updates on the various initiatives, update on any risks following the set protocols.
  • Collaborate. You will work closely with internal and external contacts to ensure we are delivering a robust solutions meeting client’s specifications.
  • Mentor. You will support and mentor the developers and support teams.
  • Develops, codes, documents and executes unit test, system, integration and acceptance test for functions of high complexity.

Requirements include:

  • Developer experience in any one of the toolsets like IBM Planning Analytics / TM1, Anaplan, Oracle Hyperion, SAP BPC
  • Integration experience on SAAS products.
  • Strong coding experience, development background with experience in solution and designing.
  • Programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Visual Basic and Java
  • Ability to extract, transform, and load data with a variety of data types. Skills in any ETL toolsets.
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Strong Proficiency with Excel, Building complex models & macros in excel

Job Summary

As a member of EPM team and a dynamic group of IBM Planning Analytics (TM1) technical specialists, The job involves leading the development, design, configuring and support of the TM1 models in line with industry best practices while collaborating with Business stakeholders and extended Finance teams. IBM Planning Analytics (TM1) technical specialists focuses on providing enterprise class design and solutions in the space of planning, budgeting, forecasting, allocations and financial consolidation to their finance partners

item.title: Manager, Physical Distribution Analytics & Planning
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Physical Distribution Analytics & Planning

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will support the Senior Director- Physical Distribution Planning and Senior Manager, Physical Network & Distribution Analytics and Planning by transforming usable data and analytics into high-level insights to inform market presence and coverage initiatives.  You will also look for opportunities for efficiency and effectiveness in reporting and presentation templates.

What will you do?

  • Responsible for data management and maintenance of unique databases of the RBC Branch Network along with competitors branch network across Canada
  • Supports in the development of planning templates and processes , and identifies opportunities to improve the capabilities and output of such templates, automating where possible
  • Conducts ongoing research and analysis to study the impact of changing client behavior and migration across channels  
  • Leveraging internal and external data to improve the capabilities of the group
  • Responsible for the prioritization and delivery of reporting requests from across PC&B supporting branch, client patterns and locations
  • Responsible for executing scoring and segmentation models and sharing results with Planning Team for downstream feedback for investment prioritization
  • Responsible for developing/updating tableau reporting views shared with PNS and P&CB
  • Responsible for all reporting requests  including generation, distribution and archival to support PNS and regional banking relative to branch network, ATM locations

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Strong analytical capabilities and ability to clearly formulate/articulate findings to stakeholders and senior management
  • Experience with GIS
  • Expertise with Alteryx and experience in reporting and presenting insights via Tableau
  • Familiarity with data manipulation programming languages such as SQL and SAS/R
  • Expert Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint skills

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

item.title: Head of Client Analytics & CRM
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Head of Client Analytics & CRM

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

This role will be responsible for driving the strategy and implementation of Client Data Initiatives and projects interfacing with senior business stakeholders across Capital Markets. Manages a portfolio of products and programs leading a team of directors, senior managers, and managers by providing financial and people resource guidance.

What will you do?

  • Responsible for All aspects of running a 100+ person team comprised of technologists - data engineers & full stack developers, business/data analysts, and user experience designers
  • CM Client Analytics – Managing multiple client analytics environments that consume data from 80+ internal and external source systems. Deep understanding of core reference data (sales teams, Client hierarchies, Sales Coverage, Roles personas and entitlements). Experience in understanding Client KPIs (revenue, profitability, resource consumption)
  • CM CRM Technology – Leading the application development team aligned to the CM Salesforce implementation and coordinating relationship management with that vendor on behalf of CM (Project Planning, Coordination & Execution:
  • Driving Implementation Strategy, Identifying risks, scoping, finding & recommending solutions Task-based scheduling, resource management, managing budgets & financial planning Managing large initiatives and taking them to implementation Strong situational analysis and decision-making abilities Tracking metrics and project performance Dealing with changes, issues, conflicts
  • Manage senior stakeholder relationships pertaining to all areas of responsibility listed above and ensure that employees understand RBC vision, as well as support and reinforce targeted behaviors that contribute to RBC goals
  • Leverage the value in unit, department, and enterprise-wide teams to develop better solutions and achieve a cross enterprise mindset
  • Successfully execute change while supporting employees through the process and keeping them focused on business priorities
  • Self-managed and results-oriented with sense of ownership Excellent oral and written communications skills Organizational skills needed to handle multiple, parallel assignments Effective in a team setting as well as in individual capacity The ability to assimilate and correlate disconnected documentation and drawings, and articulate their collective relevance to the organization and to high-priority business users

What do you need to succeed?

Must have

  • 15+ years of experience in Capital markets with detailed knowledge spanning trading and banking, multiple asset classes, and multiple regions
  • 15+ years of experience with enterprise data and analytics technologies with track record of leading & successfully delivery of data and analytics solutions in a capital markets domain context, specifically client data analytics domain
  • Extensive experience leading and managing data and analytics solution in both private and public cloud environments
  • Ability to engage senior level commercial and technical stakeholders Proven track record as a people manager running large teams
  • Strong financial acumen and demonstrated track record of managing annual budgets of $10MM+ Strong command of a banks control infrastructure, IT risk surface, and regulatory framework
  • Articulate communicator who can make the complex simple speaking to technical and commercial audiences, Strong collaborator with demonstrated track record of partnering across an organization and leading by sphere of influence

Project Management Requirements

  • Ability to manage expectations of Senior Management (Head of Sales, Head of Client Management, Head of Capital Markets) Articulation skills a must when managing Senior stakeholders Construct and administer project plans Provide detail status reports and be accountable for highly visible projects

Technical Requirements

  • Expert in a range of different data and analytics technologies Strong command of data modelling and engineering in a CM domain context Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Strong interpersonal skills, teamwork experience
  • Excellent business analysis, data analysis and user experience design skills

Job Summary

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

40

Full time

item.title: Manager, Retail Credit Cards Strategy & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Retail Credit Cards Strategy & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The RBC Credit Strategy team is hiring a Manager, Retail Credit Cards Strategy & Analytics. You will use advanced analytics to develop credit strategies to grow RBC revenue and manage risk to ultimately optimize portfolio profitability. This includes experimental design, machine learning, profitability modelling, data mining and analytics.  The successful candidate will be responsible to take initiatives through the various phases of ideation, analysis, recommendation for approval and implementation.

What will you do?

  • Use data mining, profitability modelling and business intuition to inform lending decisions for cards credit programs such as Line Management and Authorization

  • Acquire, transform and summarize data using both traditional database tools and cutting edge big data technologies

  • Leverage data driven assumptions to model out financial outcomes of credit strategies

  • Generate learnings to enhance credit strategies using Design of Experiments (DOE), Foundational Testing, Challenger/Champion and other testing methodologies

  • Develop compelling presentations to implement recommendations based on model results

  • Lead end-to-end stakeholder engagement with senior management across risk management, product, operations and other groups

  • Ensure the successful implementation and ongoing integrity of strategies and decision rules within appropriate systems

  • Measure true outcomes against expectations, driving continuous improvement and learnings from findings

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Expert problem solving skills including understanding of financial modelling

  • Proficient in SQL, Excel, SAS, Word, and PowerPoint

  • Experience with modern analytical tools and technology stacks; Python, GitHub, AWS, HDFS, etc.

  • Experience with Data Visualization tools such as Python (Matplotlib, Plotly, Seaborn) and Tableau

  • Ability to design and deliver compelling presentations to senior management and other stakeholders

  • Strong communication skills and ability to simplify and explain complex technical concepts

  • Ability to develop effective and collaborative relationships (e.g. with stakeholders, credit bureaus, and remote teams)

  • Demonstrated abilities for critical thinking and numerical analysis

  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g. statistics, engineering, economics, finance, computer science, data science or science)

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with credit risk

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, fair compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who help your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
